Dear Ms. Wilson:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 03/09/2018.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 Be signed and dated.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS.
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated child
welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which will be the
primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
The agency is inconsistent with uploading documentation into MiSACWIS.
Documentation noted were adoption evaluations, intent to adopt notification, timely
child evaluations, denial of MCI consent to adopt and signature page.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated child
welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which will be the primary
tracking system and satisfy federal reporting requirements.
The agency is inconsistent with uploading documentation into MiSACWIS.
Documentation noted were adoption evaluations, intent to adopt
notification, timely child evaluations, denial of MCI consent to adopt and
signature page.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
4

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
Discussion centered on barriers with the number of children the agency has that been
free for adoption more than 12 months (40). It was highly suggested that the agency
focus on these children and refocus on the agency recruitment plan.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency had a renewal inspection dated 01/21/2017. The agency was in
compliance with applicable rules and statutes, ISEP requirements and DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Lutheran Adoption Services
continue on a regular license.
